p: MEO revealed 93.9±1.68% inhibition of DPPH activity with an IC 50=273 µg/ml [ 14]. De Sousa Barros et al. [ 13] observed that the MEOs had an IC 50 of 5.72±0.06 mg/mL in the DPPH assay [ 13]. MEO had (p>0.05) the same inhibition level of lipid peroxidation with the synthetic antioxidant BHT and lower (p<0.001) than BHA [ 3]. A high correlation observed between DPPH scavenging activity and the total phenolic content of the M. piperita (r2>0.989) [ 29].
